meanings.definition: Speak in a low, indistinct voice, especially when complaining or expressing dissatisfaction.
meanings.sent1: She would often mutter about the cold weather under her breath.
meanings.sent2: The old man would mutter to himself while working in the garden.
meanings.sent3: As she continued to mutter about her lost keys, her cat meowed in response.
meanings.sent4: The wind seemed to mutter secrets as it rustled through the trees.
meanings.sent5: His muttering grew louder as he realized he had missed the last bus home.

meanings.definition: A low, indistinct sound made by speaking in this way.
meanings.sent1: The constant mutter of the stream was soothing to her ears.
meanings.sent2: In the quiet room, all that could be heard was the soft mutter of distant voices.
meanings.sent3: The mutter of the coffee machine in the background added to the cozy atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: The mutter of the crowd grew louder as the concert was about to begin.
meanings.sent5: The gentle mutter of the rain on the roof put her to sleep.
